page.title: 13FARMING GREAT PAXTON-OFFORD
page.content: In this area it is mainly arable farming with the main crops being barley,wheat and oats. Each year in late summer the crops are harvested andsometimes winter wheat is planted.Recently,farmers have been growing oil seed rape which brings in a good price,so in the spring the fields are a mass of bright yellow flowers.There are five farms in the block-Waterloo Farm,Low Farm, College Farm,Cotton Farm and New Close Farm. There are very few animals on these farms,only a few horses and cows. All the farms use tractors and Combine Harvesters.Some they own and some they hire,because the smaller farms can't afford to buy their own. The farmers used to bale straw and hay in rectangular bales but now they roll it in to sausage shapes.
